page.title: 08PLASTIC SURGERY UNIT,ODSTOCK
page.content: The unit opened soon after world war 2 with 22 beds.It has since become famous as a specialist research & treatment unit with 97 beds in 1985.89 nursing & ancillary staff are employed with 5 doctors,4 consultants.within the unit is a separate Burns Unit:some cosmetic surgery, but mainly deals with injury or congenital deformity.Caters for,Hants, Wilts, Dorset, I.of Wight, Channel I.Cases from outside area,especially accidents in Petroleum Industry.Injury survival time & death rates much improved over recent years.Important work in skin growth research.Plastic unit still in wartime wards.Burns unit about 20 years old.Equipment expensive e.g.laser tubes used to remove birth marks cost Â£5000 each.Govt.cuts threaten to restrict further work.
